title: Keema Aloo (Ground Beef and Potatoes) Recipe
description: Keema aloo is an Indian curry made with ground beef and potatoes, tomatoes, peas, fresh ginger, cilantro, and lots of spices for a flavor-packed meal.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Asian Indian Main Dishes Curry Keema Aloo (Ground Beef and Potatoes) 4.6 (340) 268 Reviews 113 Photos This keema aloo curry is by far my favorite Indian recipe. Inspired by my mom, who still makes this for me to this day. If you want to try something a little different, I guarantee you will love this meal. Submitted by The Meatetarian Updated on June 21, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 113 113 113 113 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 55 mins Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil 1 extra-large onion, chopped 2 tablespoons water (Optional) 2 pounds lean ground beef 4 cloves garlic, minced 2 tablespoons grated fresh ginger root 1 serrano chile pepper, finely chopped 2 teaspoons chopped fresh cilantro 1 tablespoon ground coriander 1 ½ teaspoons salt 1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin 1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper 1 teaspoon ground turmeric 3 potatoes, peeled and diced 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes 1 cup frozen green peas 1 teaspoon garam masala Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook and stir until soft and beginning to brown, about 12 minutes. If browned bits of onion are stuck to the bottom of the pan, add water and stir to loosen. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir ground beef, garlic, ginger, serrano chile, and cilantro into the pan; cook and stir until beef is browned and crumbly, 10 to 15 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in coriander, salt, cumin, cayenne pepper, and turmeric; cook and stir until flavors blend, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add potatoes and tomatoes; cover and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in green peas and cook until sauce has slightly thickened and flavors have blended, 10 to 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Sprinkle garam masala over top, cover, and let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 679 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 362 Calories 18g Fat 23g Carbs 26g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 362 % Daily Value * Total Fat 18g 23% Saturated Fat 6g 30% Cholesterol 74mg 25% Sodium 687mg 30% Total Carbohydrate 23g 9% Dietary Fiber 4g 16% Total Sugars 5g Protein 26g 51% Vitamin C 29mg 33% Calcium 74mg 6% Iron 6mg 31% Potassium 816mg 17% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Keema Aloo (Ground Beef and Potatoes) 01 of 113 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 113 Photo by  Eric 01/26/2023 Made this the other night and it was delicious!! I added a little curry powder which turned out to be a nice touch. 03 of 113 Photo by  LisaLPharmD 06/29/2022 Really delicious recipe! Ground beef is not typically served in Indian food, so it was an interesting fusion that you won’t get in a restaurant. My only change was that I needed to cook the potatoes longer, and I only had ground ginger on hand. Would definitely make again. 04 of 113 Photo by  Cheryl Blake 01/28/2022 Next time, I'll let the peas cook for a few extra minutes. No other changes. Yum! 05 of 113 Photo by  Kari Fenton 01/10/2022 We love this recipe! Occasionally we use canned potatoes if we do not have fresh on hand! 06 of 113 Photo by  Beththewinediva 12/18/2021 This is an easy going recipe . Great directions. I make my own garam masala, and added chopped carrots. Served with homemade sourdough. Delicious! 07 of 113 Photo by  Barbara Schmitz 09/07/2021 08 of 113 Photo by  Barbara Schmitz 09/07/2021 09 of 113 Photo by  Roxy 08/15/2021 10 of 113 Photo by  Jeff Wright 05/11/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Kheema Malai Kofta 11 Ratings Aloo Gobi Masala (Cauliflower and Potato Curry) 76 Ratings Keema Matar (Beef and Pea Curry) 22 Ratings Goan Beef Curry 1 Rating Chicken Saag 86 Ratings Chickpea Curry with Carrots 1 Rating Chicken Madras 6 Ratings Paneer Tikka Masala 14 Ratings Goan Chicken Masala Curry 1 Rating Spicy Indian Dahl 152 Ratings Chana Masala (Indian Chickpea Curry) 215 Ratings Curried Beef with Winter Vegetables 19 Ratings Baingan Bharta (Eggplant Curry) 493 Ratings Indian Goat Curry 1 Rating Slow Cooker Butter Chicken 719 Ratings Lamb Korma 15 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
